meanings.definition: The act of producing a high-pitched sound by blowing air through pursed lips.
meanings.sent1: Her whistling echoed through the forest.
meanings.sent2: I heard the sweet whistling of a bird outside my window.
meanings.sent3: The whistling of the wind sounded like a ghostly choir.
meanings.sent4: The whistling of the kettle signaled it was time for tea.
meanings.sent5: The whistling of the train conductor warned of the approaching train.

meanings.definition: A tune or melody produced by whistling.
meanings.sent1: His whistling of a popular song brightened up the room.
meanings.sent2: The cheerful whistling of the boy made everyone smile.
meanings.sent3: The whistling of the tune was so catchy, it stuck in my head all day.
meanings.sent4: The whistling of the melody carried through the air like a gentle breeze.
meanings.sent5: Her whistling of the tune was so melodious, it could rival a bird's song.

meanings.definition: Making a high-pitched sound like that of whistling.
meanings.sent1: The whistling teapot was ready for tea.
meanings.sent2: The whistling wind outside made the trees sway.
meanings.sent3: The whistling sound of the kettle was music to her ears.
meanings.sent4: The whistling sound of the wind added an eerie feel to the night.
meanings.sent5: The whistling sound of the wind was a constant companion on the hike.
